author: omgstfu
post_text: October 22, 2014 at 7:01 PM#1I am writing a page + macro that will change to the next page, off everything from the previous executors and then select the first fader on the page. I am having trouble getting the first cue to fire though. I am trying to avoid using something like "go executor 10.1"  because the songs may not be in the same order every day so if I move pages and forget to update the macros I would fire the wrong cue. It would also mean I needed a separate macro for each page. Could someone help me out?

posts.post_text: October 22, 2014 at 11:01 PM#2If you just type: Go Executor 1, it will execute the first executor on the current page so no worries to accidentally giving a go on another pageSo your macro could look something like this (tested in V3.0.0.5 (or download attached macro, Only edit the executor number to your needs)):Page + (Sets the next page)Select Executor 1 (Select the first executor of the new current page)Go Executor 1 (Fires the first executor off the current page)Off Executor 1  Thru 100  Page Thru - $faderpage;  Off Executor 101  Thru 220  Page Thru - $buttonpage (Switches off all other pages/executors except the executors on the current page)FilesGoto next page- kill all other pages.xml828 Byte – 108 Downloads
